chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorinda J. Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: Fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination and when not fully engaged defendant must complete 15 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless prescribed.
Not to be on the premises of any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

Counseling as recommended by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Case called: 2:13 pm
Includes 15CF122 and 15CF146.
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Robin Kennedy;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves:
15CF122:
Ct. 1 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters, or Commission Wardens-Repeater)>> State moves to Dismiss Repeater Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Theft-Movable Property-Repeater)>>DRI.

15CF146:
Ct. 1 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters, or Commission Wardens-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
15CF122:
Ct. 1 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters, or Commission Wardens-Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

15CF146:
Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.
Ct. 5 (DC-Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF122:
Ct. 1 (Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters, or Commission Wardens-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 3 years probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 38 days jail MCJ, I/S 120 days MCJ w/Huber priviliges for work/school/treatment, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless prescribed, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended by agent, Not be on the premises of any bars, taverns, or liquor stores, Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours Community Service a week, Court Costs. COURT finds 38 days credit.

15CF146:
Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>Sentence W/H-  1 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 38 days jail MCJ, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless prescribed, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended by agent, Not be on the premises of any bars, taverns, or liquor stores, Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours Community Service a week, Court Costs. COURT finds 38 days credit.

Ct. 5 (DC-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H-  1 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 38 days jail MCJ, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless prescribed, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended by agent, Not be on the premises of any bars, taverns, or liquor stores, Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours Community Service a week, Court Costs. COURT finds 38 days credit.
